question: Laser trabeculoplasty is indicated in which of the following?
exp: Ans. b. Pseudoexfoliative glaucoma (Ref: Yanoff and Duker 4/e p1072). Laser trabeculoplasty is indicated in Pseudoexfoliative glaucoma. 'Argon or selective laser trabeculoplasty can be performed in pseudoexfoliative glaucoma patients if the angle is open enough to allow laser application. Laser trabeculoplasty is reported to have a higher success rate in pseudoexfoliative glaucoma patients than in POAG and therefore is often used earlier in the management of pseudoexfoliative cases. ' - Yanoff and Duker 4/e p1072

question: Laser iridotomy is useful in
exp: Ans. (a) Angle closure glaucoma. Ref.: A. K. Khurana 6th ed. 1247

question: Iridectomy is a treatment option in:
exp: Ans: B (Angle closure glaucoma) Ref: Basak Diseases of the eye 5th edition, pg no 455. Explanation: IRIDECTOMY: Abciston of a portion of the iris usually done in the upper part where it is covered by the upper lid. Types of iridectomy: Peripheral Button Hole Iridectomy. Indications: Angle closure glaucoma. As a part of trabeculectomy operation. In Intracapsular cataract extraction. In penetrating keratoplasty. To prevent Pupillary Block Glaucoma. Complete Iridectomy. Optical Iridectomy- Done in eases of Central corneal opacity, axial congenital cataract. IRIDOTOMY: Section of the iris without abscising any portion of it. Indications: To create artificial pupil. Laser iridotomv - PACG & post operative papillary block glaucoma4 point iridotomv - to prevent glaucoma in iris bombe.
